citation.article-title: Reclassification of Rhodobium marinum and Rhodobium pfennigii as Afifella marina gen. nov. comb. nov. and Afifella pfennigii comb. nov., a new genus of photoheterotrophic Alphaproteobacteria and emended descriptions of Rhodobium, Rhodobium orientis and Rhodobium gokarnense.

p.s: Emended description of R. gokarnense (Srinivas et al., 2007)
R. gokarnense (go’kar.nen.se. N. L. neut. adj. gokarnense pertaining to Gokarna, the place from which the type strain was isolated).

The description is identical to that given in the original publication [28] and in the emended description given above, but the strain grows well at up to 14% NaCl (w/v), does not exhibit growth with acetate, butyrate or mannitol, and the DNA G+C content of its genome is 65.8 mole %.
The strain number ATCC BAA-1215T is invalid as it does not correspond to the type strain of the species.
